content:
The provided code chunk is part of a method within the DirectManipulate class, specifically handling camera manipulations in Panda3D. This particular section sets up an animation interval (ival) for repositioning or rotating the camera relative to the render node using easeInOut blending. It then appends a function to reparent the camera and starts the manipulation task by invoking __startManipulateCamera with the defined interval.

**Context:**

This code is part of a method in DirectManipulate that configures an animation interval for adjusting the camera's position or orientation relative to the render node, using easeInOut blending. It concludes by initiating the camera manipulation process through the __startManipulateCamera method.

other = render,
                                            blendType = 'easeInOut')
        ival = Sequence(ival, Func(self.reparentCam, parent),
                        name = 'manipulateCamera')
        self.__startManipulateCamera(ival = ival)
